573416-d-10-27-07-GTW.Narrative: TRAIN C70891-27 WAS SPOTTING LOADED COAL CARS AT THE BOARD OF WATER AND LIGHT POWER.  THE CREW SHOVED 48 LOADS INTO TRACK 0 AND LEFT FOUL AT THE WEST END OF THE YARD.  THEY THEN SHOVED 24 LOADS INTO TRACK 1 OUT AT THE WEST END RESULTING IN A SIDESWIPE WITH THE CARS IN THE FOUL ON TRACK 0.  NO CARS WERE DERAILED BUT CARS GEAX 3223, GEAX 3074 AND GEAX 3009 ALL SUSTAINED DAMAGE IN THE IMPACT.  THE CONDUCTOR AND TRAINEE WERE REASONABLE CAUSE TESTED AND RESULTS WERE ALL NEGATIVE.  INVESTIGATION INTOTHE INCIDENT FOUND THAT THERE WAS NOT A MAN IN POSITION AT THE WEST END OF THE YARD.  HE WAS LOCATEDON THE NORTH SIDE OF TRACK #0 AND COULD NOT SEE THE CARS GOING INTO #1 TRACK ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF TRACK #0.

DE0740-d-10-18-07-DQE.Narrative:
ON OCTOBER 18, 2007 THE WEST DAY LOCAL WENT ON DUTY AT 6:00 AM IN DE QUEEN, AR AT MILE POST 50.  THEWDL PUT THEIR TRAIN TOGETHER AND DEPARTED DE QUEEN WITH 22 LOADS AND 37 EMPTIES, WEST FOR VALLIANT,OK AT MILE POST 0.  THE CREW STOPPED IN WRIGHT CITY, OK AT MILE POST 8 TO SET OUT 38 CARS ON THE LOOP TRACK IN THE WRIGHT CITY YARD.  THEY CAME BACK OUT OF THE LOOP TRACK TO THE MAIN AND PICKED UP THE REST OF THEIR TRAIN, 21 LOADS OF MIXED FREIGHT.  THERE WERE TWO HAZMAT CARS ON THE END OF THE TRAIN.  THE WDL WAS OPERATING UNDER YARD LIMIT RULE AS THE APPROACHED HIGHWAY 98 CROSSING.  THEY HAD A TRACK WARRANT, WARRANT NUMBER SEVEN (7), PROCEED FROM MILE POST 23 TO VALLIANT.  ON THE WARRANT NUMBER 7 UNDER "OTHER SPECIFIC INSTRUCTIONS: THEY WERE INSTRUCTED TO FLAG NEW 98 CROSSING AT WRIGHT CITY.AFTER COUPLING INTO THEIR TRAIN THEY WERE APPROXIMATELY 1/2 MILE FROM 98 CROSSING.  THE CONDUCTORSTATED THAT THEY HAD A JOB BRIEFING AS THE LOCOMOTIVE BEGAN TO FLAG THE CROSSING
THE BRAKEMAN NORMALLY RIDES THE TRAILING LOCOMOTIVE BUT WAS ON THE HEAD END TO FLAG THE CROSSING.  THE CONDUCTOR STARTED DOING HIS PAPER WORK AND DID NOT LOOK UP UNTIL THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY. THE CROSSING WAS NOT FLAGGED. THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY 75 FT FROM THE EAST END OF THE CROSSING SURFACE.  THE LEADLOCOMOTIVE HAD FULLY OCCUPIED THE CROSSING WHEN A LOADED LOG TRUCK COLLIDED. #39 M503 A VANDAL STOLEALL OF THE WIRING FROM THE HIGHWAY GRADE CROSSING SYSTEM - IMPOSSIBLE FOR THE SIGNAL SYSTEM TO WORK

DRIVER APPEARED TO BE FIDGETING AND ATONE POINT LOOKED AS THOUGH HE WAS GOING TO REMOVE SELF FROM THE RAIL TOWARD THE SOUTH, BUT THEN RETURNED TO SAME POSITION UNTIL TRAIN MADE IMPACT. CREW WAS BLOWING WHISTLE, RINGING BELL & HAD PLACEDTRAIN INTO EMERGENCY. DRIVER SUSTAINED FATAL INJURIES - DRIVER'S ACTIONS OBSERVED BY CREW SUGGESTEDSUICIDE. NO INJURIES TO CREW. AUTO WAS PUSHED APPROXIMATELY 3,400 FEET AND DESTROYED ELECTRIC LOCK AT MP 240.4 BEFORE TRAIN CAME TO STOP.

794-d-10-22-07-VTR.Accident Cause: Broken Rail - Head and web separation (outside joint bar limits)  [Desc.Changed-Refer to Current/Pre
794-d-10-22-07-VTR.Narrative:
ON 10-22-07 THE RD-BD TRAIN WAS PROCEEDING NORTH INTO THE TOWN OF MIDDLEBURY.  AT 1355 THE TRAIN WASINTO THE MIDDLEBURY YARD LIMITS AT MILEAGE 87.3  AND WAS TRAVELING AT A SPEED OF 10-11 MILES PER HOUR, THE TRAIN CREW THEN FELT A SLIGHT TUGGING ACTION ON THEIR TRAIN LIKE TRAIN SLACK.  THEN THE TRAIN CAME TO A STOP WITHOUT THE ENGINEER APPLYING THE BRAKES, ONCE THE TRAIN STOPPED THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY.  THE CONDUCTOR OF THE 
TRAIN THEN IMMEDIATELY STARTED TO WALK BACK TO SEE WHAT HAD HAPPENED, HE THEN NOTICED SEVERAL CARS ON THE GROUND AS HE WALKED BACK, HE ALSO SAW SEVERAL SALT CARS ON THEIR SIDES AND THEN HE SAW THE HAZARDOUS MATERIAL CARS ON THEIR SIDES AS WELL WITH BLACK SMOKE COMING FROM A COUPLE OF THEM.  UPON INVESTIGATION IT WAS FOUND THAT THE RAIL HAD A HEAD WEB SEPARATIONUNDERNEATH ONE OF THE LEAD CARS OF THE TRAIN.  SEVERAL CARS RODER OVER THE BROKEN RAIL BEFORE THE SALT CAR # CLSX 5759 DERAILED AS A RESULT OF THE BRAKE THUS CAUSING THIS CAR TO SINK INTO THE SOFT WET GROUND TIPPING THE CAR TO A POINT WHERE IT ROLLED OVER ONTO ITS SIDE CAUSING THE CARS AHEAD OF ITTO DERAIL AND THE CARS BEHING IT TO OVERTURN ON THEIR SIDES AS WELL.  THE SHELF COUPLERS ON THE HAZARDOUS MATERIAL GAS CARS NEVER UN COUPLED CAUSING A CHAIN REACTION THROUGHOUT THE REST OF THE HAZARDOUS MATERIAL CARS ROLLING THEM ONTO THEIR SIDES EVEN AS THE TRAIN WAS AT A STOP AND MANY CAR LENGTHSFROM THE POINT OF DERAILMENT.  THE HAZMAT THAT WAS RELEASED WAS GASOLINE, 500 GALLONS WERE RELEASED,

MEA332-d-10-02-07-NIRC.Narrative: ON OCTOBER 2, 2007, AT APPROX. 6:21P.M. METRA TRAIN NO. 405 DERAILED TRAVELING SOUTH ON THE NORTHBOUND TRACK AT MILE POST 10.23, 71ST AND YATES AT THE SOUTH SHORE STATION IN SOUTH CHICAGO.  TRAIN #405WAS A FOUR CAR CONSIST, 1559, 1650, 1573, & 1548, THE TWO NORTH CARS #1573 & #1548 DERAILED.  TRUCKA OF #1573 WAS ON THE GROUND AND TRUCK B OF #1548 WAS ON THE GROUND.  THERE WERE NO REPORTED INJURIES AT THE TIME OF THIS ACCIDENT.  THE DERAILMENT WAS BELIEVED TO HAVE OCCURRED DUE TO WIDE GAGE IN THE RAIL.  THE SPEED LIMIT IN THE CURVE IS 15MPH, THE REST OF THE TERRITORY IS 30MPH.  HULCHER WAS CALLED TO RE-RAIL CONSIST  NOS. 1573 & 1548.  THE SOUTH CHICAGO SUB. WAS SHUT DOWN UNTIL APPROX. 2:00A.M. ON OCTOBER 3, 2007.

101100407-d-10-04-07-TSRR.Narrative: THIS REPORT CONTAINS FACTORS THAT WERE INVOLVED IN THE DERAILMENT AT ASHWOOD SIDING IN MAURY COUNTY.ON 10/04/07 TSRR 101 WENT ON DUTY IN LAWRENCEBURG TN AT 0500.  THEY PROCEEDED TO ASHWOOD TO PICK UP A CAR OFF THE SIDING AT APPROXIMATELY 0800.  THEY BACKED IN THE SIDING AND COUPLED UP TO AN EMPTYFLAT CAR.  AS THEY PULLED OUT OF THE SIDING, THE CAR (SOO 115979) TRUCKS ON THE SOUTH END OF THE CARDID NOT SWIVEL CAUSING THE TRUCKS TO DERAIL.  THE TRUCKS BURIED IN THE BALLAS AND WEDGED AGAINST THE HEAD BLOCK TIES.  THIS CAUSED THE NEST SOUTH CAR TO DERAIL ON THE ADJACENT END.  THE HAZARDOUS CARIN THE CONSIST WAS LOCATED 11 CARS NORTH OF THE DERAILMENT.  THEREFORE IT WAS NOT INVOLVED IN ANY WAY.  ALSO THERE WERE 3 ARTICULATED CARS IN THE CONSIST THAT WERE 8 CARS NORTH OF THE DERAILMENT.  THESE WRE NOT INVOLVED IN THE DERAILMENT.  NO DRUG AND ALCOHOL TEST WERE DEEMED TO BE NECESSSARY FOR THE TRAIN CREW.

THE SOUTH CHICAGO SUB. WAS SHUT DOWN UNTIL APPROX. 2:00A.M. ONOCTOBER 3, 2007.
